cree.text: Only when the last tree has died and the last river been poisoned and the last fish been caught will we realise we cannot eat money.
A forest that has sheltered you, you should not call a patch of scrub.
If you want heaven to know, tell it to the wind.
Sometimes I go about in pity for myself, and all the while a great wind is bearing me across the sky.
When the mouth stumbles, it is worse than when the foot does.
Sometimes I go about in pity for myself, and all the while a great wind is bearing me across the sky.
